title: Missing info in Taks Manager of WSL processes
body:
WSL processes neither show their command line nor their image path in Windows Task Manager. Only the name of WSL executables stripped off prepending paths is visible.
Although this probably can be achieved from a bash shell it would be nice to also have it present in the Task Manger as to increase the integration of WSL with the rest of Windows.

comments.body: In the meantime, we got top and ps aux.
